author: projectnewm
title: Digital Identity Integration
description: Disputes might arise among artist in reference to intellectual honesty. There must be a connection between real world identity and wallet addresses for effective legal recourse.

f6_assessments.q0:
NewM will be a decentralized music ecosystem, a marketplace where artists can monetize and take control of their work. The team behind the project has great development plans and they are betting big on Catalyst funding, since this is one of their five Fund 9 proposals funding the core of the project, for a total of 480k USD, and an additional proposal seeking funding for an open source project that will indirectly benefit NewM. 

This proposal seeks funding for the establishment of a digital identity integration tool, but sadly the details are very confusing since this proposal is closely connected with another one - KYC integration. As a reminder, our goal here is to create the legal and financial tools that can assist Catalyst proposers in better managing their projects from these points of view and we can only suppose that the proposal’s title means that its content is well connected with challenge, but we cannot be sure. Let’s go through the project in a bit more detail. 

For a better understanding of the subject it’s necessary first of all to put things into a wider context - and that is to understand the great potential of the music royalties market. More than a decade ago the industry was suffering due to extensive piracy, but in the last years the industry has begun to grow again, due mainly to online streaming and its advantages compared to the old distribution channels: convenience, personalization, accessibility. Therefore the music industry is generating constant revenue every year, and there is even a school of thought that considers the royalties associated with it to be an asset class of its own. Barron’s estimates that US annual royalty revenues to be over 40 billion USD, while the proposers estimate the overall market for at over 1 trillion USD (a bit optimistic let’s say). The main idea being that the music royalties market has a great potential to tap into, and gaining even a small market share from the overall pie is going to be a very lucrative business in the long run. 

There is also a very good scalability potential behind the project, since after the development phase, the marginal cost of servicing an additional artist, an additional NFT or an additional smart contract are negligible in comparison to the high margins ubiquitous among the industry. 



In conclusion, NewM has excellent development prospects, can be a tremendous asset for the Cardano community in the long run, and this proposal is well aligned with the challenge. 

However, this proposal is unfinished, so I have to offer only three stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
A first excellent point relevant for the proposal’s feasibility is that the proposal is complemented by a white paper in which the concept and business model are presented in great detail, and the writers go to great lengths to ensure that no details are left out. There are extensive descriptions of the functionalities of the marketplace, the utilities of the token they wish to launch as well as how the DAO accompanying the marketplace will function. 

Let’s talk about the team. Ryan, the CEO, has a very deep understanding of the music industry, can articulate extremely well the value proposition that NewM can bring and he is also in charge of developing partnerships. Florian, the finance guy, was instrumental at the beginning, since he was the one that shaped the business model. Andrew, the CTO and security guy, has a long track record of delivering open source tools to the Cardano community, amongst other the development of a Cardano node CLI tool (command line interface). Including advisors, they have onboarded in excess of 30 members, very diverse in their backgrounds and a fairly geographically distributed team. All of them are presented on their website with links to their profiles (and what music they listen to, of course). So there’s a solid team behind the project. 

Let’s talk about funding sources and financial viability. Right now the team self-funds the development of NewM, and they are securing additional funding through their own stakepool. A strength of NewM’s business model (once it launches) is that it will not be reliant on just one stream for revenues - from the beginning the marketplace will focus on two separate sources of revenue: a streaming component trying to give established streaming companies a run for their money and a marketplace component focused on fractionalizing and distributing intellectual property rights as NFTs. In the whitepaper we are also offered a breakdown of their token distribution, which will begin modestly in 2022 and will continue until 2027. In conclusion, in addition to Catalyst, NewM will have various revenue streams, another excellent indication of the project’s good feasibility prospects. 

This proposal is sadly unfinished. For the detailed plan it is written “Implementing KYC: see other proposal”. For the budget “Future Edits forthcoming”. For this reason I have to offer only two stars.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team is in the right spot to ensure full auditability of the project. They have already set-up community engagement tools (Discord, Telegram, Twitter, etcetera) and are frequently present on podcasts (Learn Cardano for instance). The founders are making themselves available within these channels and are actively engaging in discussions with the community when being queried regarding the details of the project (I have firsthand experience on this). We have therefore good reasons to believe that the Cardano community will be in a good position to interact with the team, as they are connected to the ecosystem in more than one way. 


This proposal is sadly unfinished. For the tracking measures it is written “Future Edits forthcoming”. The measures of success are very brief and vague. For this reason I have to offer only two stars.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Providing all individuals who fractionalize ip rights with DIDs" is an excellent idea. I've been following projectNEWM for a while and am a big fan of the work and impact it will have on the music industry.

As far as this proposal and this challenge is concern, I'm having trouble seeing how this proposal caters to funded projects.  The single 26 word paragraph does provide enough detail of how the "proposed solution will address the Challenge." Some questions that would have been good to answer:

Is this a general purpose open source did issuing framework other funded projects can use to as part a legal or financial service pipeline?  

What is the legitimacy of these DiDs? In what Jurisdictions? 

If this is just a reference implementation for project, where with documentation, tutorial or guidelines be published? Or will this result into a peer-review paper?
f6_assessments.q1: There is no budget breakdown. There is no details about milestone or timeline, instead the proposal just have "Implementing KYC: see other proposal." What other proposal? Is every 30+ person at projectnewm.io working on this specific proposal? In what capacity? who will do what and what are their qualifications?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has no details about how it plans to manage the work internally or how the community can follow along. Project definition of success is not tied back to the challenge definition of success. Who will the community access if they solution delivered is one we asked for in the challenge?

f6_assessments.q0:
From my knowledge, Project Newm is one of the few and most famous projects on Cardano looking into building NFT minting and distribution solutions for music artists and labels. I was happy to find a proposal in Project Catalyst that deals with the problems they are looking to solve.
The proposal focuses on a very important aspect of intellectual property rights - DID's and KYCs. The two together would form the solution to fraud security and legal rights.
The development team is working on building a system that incorporates DIDs and KYC on their platform, where artists can create accounts, upload and mint their music, select to fractionalise their work if they so desire and more.
Music NFTs haven’t become mainstream yet, and for now, there is no music marketplace or standards when dealing with this type of content. 
In short, I find there's a big potential for this proposal to be really impactful if implemented well. Perhaps most importantly, it can cut down on exploitative contracts that take advantage of young and inexperienced music artists.
f6_assessments.q1:
The content of the detailed plan subsection is disappointing, as I was expecting to read a proposal that I would be happy about. The entire answer for the detailed plan section states: “Implementing KYC: see other proposal”. And this is it. No external link. No other text whatsoever.
Unfortunately, the same applies to the budget breakdown: “Future Edits forthcoming”.
I think the team is very capable and it’s not a matter of not knowing or caring about what they were supposed to write in these sections. I noticed that the last edit of the proposal was done on June 22nd, which is about a week before the submission deadline. As such, I imagine they didn’t manage to find the time to finalise the proposal.
However, the reason is not important, and I cannot in good faith, rate this section with more than a 2.
f6_assessments.q2:
As with the feasibility section, one of the questions in the auditability section is also unanswered - “Future Edits forthcoming” is the only available piece of text for the question regarding the project’s progress measurements. 
And for the success description, the one-sentence answer does provide a glimpse into the team’s vision, yet no kind of metrics were offered. 
Just like I wrote in the feasibility section, I believe the team is too competent to need advice about what to write in these 2 sections of the proposal. Since they have probably been to busy to finalise it,  I will be refraining from giving any advice.
Please note that at the moment, the answers are incomplete and therefore render the proposal incomplete as well. I hope that the team will resubmit the proposal in a future funding round where they provide detailed answers to all of these questions.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal,  and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano Digital Identity challenge. At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is poorly explained and in my opinion it doesn’t clear how Cardano smart Contracts and blockchain technology will be used and it doesn’t clear how this proposal can create incentive for users.
I think it's important to improve details about the proposal solution for the challenge (eg. Typical services use case for users and community, example benefit for service creator and partners, …)
f6_assessments.q1:
There are only one link in the proposal that refers to website projectnewm.io (Fair music ecosystem built on Cardano), but it is not possibile to identify the teams the work on the proposal and the proposal assessment is difficult.
The scope of the solution is not explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…). 
I think that this proposal is linked with other implementation proposal (a Digital Identity Solution for all content creators on projectNEWM), but there aren’t informations at all.
f6_assessments.q2: There aren’t given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do. As mentioned above, the description of the solution isn’t explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, how the solution improve their customer experience, and so on…), so the progress of this proposal is not simple to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: This integration is pioneering new ways of connecting IRL events on blockchain, which has potential to lay groundwork and create best practices for other types of IRL material to be documented on blockchain with legal aspects in mind.  It also addresses IP rights, a  currently debated topic in the community brought to the fore by visual IP legal questions in another project.  This integration is aligned with the NEWM's real world sensible goal to “eliminate the middleman” so that artists and stakeholders will receive what is due to them.  This is truly a complex problem in the modern music industry that needs solving – if this is solved on Cardano, an important precedent will be set and it will reflect very well on Cardano as well as other blockchains as feasible solutions to real world problems.  Risks and future challenges are vague in the proposal, I would like to see them spelled out more and learn more about the team's security advisor.  For this reason, I rate Impact at 4 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: When I look for a detailed plan/timeline, I am advised to “see other proposal”.  I would like to see the detailed plan and delivery in the proposal at hand, or at least be given the title of the proposal so I could search for it in a timely manner.  However, when I found the KYC Solution proposal, there is a breakdown of a 6 stage timeline.  There is a brief but clear breakdown of the budget.  The projectnewm.io website provides photos and a brief comment on each team member's specialty.  The proposal indicates that there are 3 lawyers on their team, but I only see one advisor with legal credentials listed on their team.  This tells me that to some extent, they do have a legal expert who has thought some of this out and they plan to use this funding to consult with other experts to find a realistic solution.  Rated 3 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: 6 stage timeline listed, “Future edits forthcoming.”  No measurable goals/measurable indication of success.  I have had interactions with the team in the community and feel that they can deliver on this proposal on their past merits, but the language in the proposal doesn't specify roadmap/outcomes for the DID integration specifically.  Rated 2 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: I thought this idea was very good and important. It is about creating a platform that will engage directly with the artist, managers/management companies, labels, catalog holders, as well as live concert venues (live nation). The problem here is, as the proponent said, there are limited ways to connect blockchain tech with IRL events. So the idea is there has to be a legal entity to take custody of said rights. No rights holder will use a platform where they are restricted with no legal recourse due to malicious third-party actors. I think this fits perfectly with the objectives of the challenge because here we are looking to fund a project that serves to promote adoption and improve product ownership. The objectives of this proposal would be precisely to make these services more accessible, transparent, and auditable, as we can infer from the excerpt “When creating an account on our platform the content will be required to go through KYC if they chose to fractionalize/mint their audio files. For added security that a consumer is indeed purchasing a song IP from the intended artist, we will implement a checkmark system built upon DIDs”. In other words, as a result of KYC and DIDs, they will legitimize the trading of IP rights securely and responsibly. This will facilitate a transition from Blockchain to RealFi and pave the way to an equitable platform for ALL creators and consumers. For these reasons, I consider this proposal to be of maximum impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, I found this part very insufficient. It is said superficially. The roadmap does not exist. What happens in production? Who will do that? Regarding the budget, we don’t know how the money would be used. Why are 75 thousand dollars needed for this project? Who will do that, in what order, and why? Which marketing campaign would be adopted here and why. We also don’t know how much time the team members would dedicate to the work, to calculate the value of their working hours, for example. Now speaking of the team, the author just said that team can be found at bottom of the website projectnewm.io. But from what I found on the website, especially the professionals involved, this part leaves a lot to be desired because the information is even more superficial. We just have their profile images, their names, and their title jobs. It’s not explained in detail what they’ve done so far and how they get involved with the Cardano ecosystem. How can we prove that they are prepared for this project? I think it would be necessary for more detailed explanations to be attached to each of these parts.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the process is very superficial and inadequate. The proponent just claims that “Future Edits forthcoming”. How could we audit the progress of things? At first, it would be essential that a script be prepared. That way, we would have a basis on which to audit. We would know which activities should be developed in each time interval. With that, we have goals, and partial results to be achieved. Speaking of the end results, again we only have a very abstract scenario being represented: “Successful implementation of a Digital Identity Solution for all content creators on projectNEWM”. Yeah, so we that this is the main objective of the proposal. However, how can we verify that result, if something was missing? How can we measure the project? How has all this impacted the Cardano ecosystem? It lacked the proponent to define more objective and practical ways of how success would be perceived, in addition to determining what success would be. In general, the proposal is not auditable at all.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to implement digital identity integration on the platform of ProjectNEWM. In order to be able to grow the business of music and other similar digital assets, it will be necessary to complete the legal work of KYC and decentralized identification. The proposed solution is to build a framework and implementation process. The project, if successfully implemented, will not only have an impact on the ProjectNEWM project in particular, but also on all realfi projects. Therefore, the scalability of this project is huge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal says there are 3 lawyers in the legal team, but cannot check their information in the White Paper. Therefore, it is not possible to capture their relevant experience as well as their performance ability. The detailed implementation plan as well as the detailed implementation cost of the proposed amount of USD 75,000 have not been updated in the proposal. The proposal mentions 2 risks, Identity Theft & Development Risk, but the limited measure given is “Work with our security advisor Michael Fazio” is not convincing enough.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal doesn't have a clear implementation plan and the objectives associated with specific timelines. So it is difficult to audit the development progress of the project. The proposal also did not provide appropriate KPIs. The project has a very clear goal of “Successful implementation of a Digital Identity Solution for all content creators“. However, how successful the implementation is and how much is not really clear. Proposer should come up with a quantifiable goal like 10,000 content creators within 12 months, for example.

f6_assessments.q0: IP rights play a very important role in the crypto space. Especially to support a fair distribution and guarantee of rights. However, the most important thing is that the right person can also claim their rights. Suitable KYC solutions are necessary for this. Through this proposal, future artists who want to use the blockchain will be assured that their rights are protected. However, the KYC is a centralized solution and therefore the Challenge is not tackled to an appropriate degree. Above all, a decentralized solution, which would also be applicable for Cardano members, is to be welcomed.
f6_assessments.q1: After reviewing all available materials (website, lightpaper), it can be assumed that this is a good and experienced team. Above all, it is easy to see how the existing product is structured and why exactly KYC is needed here. However, it remains questionable how exactly the budget is used and why exactly such a high amount of money has to be used. From a legal point of view, however, it must also be asked what type of token is available on the basis of the purchasable IP rights, which could theoretically still become a problem for the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Crucially missing is how the other Proposer/Cardano Members should hear about the implementation of KYC for their project. There is no information about any milestones, furthermore the communication channel is missing. A detailed breakdown of the steps for a successful KYC would be welcome, so that others can benefit from it as well.

solution: projectNEWM aims to provide all individuals who fractionalize ip rights with DIDs.
experience: Andrew Westberg (Creator of Phyrhose, JorManager, PoolPerks, etc) leads our dev team with over 60 cumulative years of professional experience. Our legal team has over 25 years of legal experience.
